executive_summary: Jewelry manufacturers produce jewelry items or silverware using precious or semiprecious metals and stones. Jewelry sales are largely discretionary in nature. Luxury and custom jewelry items are dependent on downstream demand from consumers. Per capita disposable income has increased in recent years, although these increases did not translate to higher demand in 2020, mainly due to increasing uncertainty. Similarly, the global price of gold and silver skyrocketed since the pandemic, with jewelry prices following closely. Manufacturers are characterized by significant price competition, resulting in falling demand amid higher prices. These factors have led to jewelry manufacturing revenue falling at an estimated CAGR of 2.3% to $21.4 billion through 2024, including a 2.4% dip that year alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: CURRENT ECONOMIC UNCERTAINTY AFFECTS JEWELRY SALES
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Unfavorable economic conditions in recent years, including elevated inflation and heightened economic uncertainty, have led to significant revenue losses for jewelry manufacturing. When consumers are unsure about the future of the economy, they become more likely to lower discretionary spending, negatively impacting jewelry sales.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC LOWERED DISCRETIONARY SPENDING
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The initial hit of the COVID-19 pandemic resulted in weaker luxury items sales. One factor influencing the decline was social distancing regulations, keeping consumers from their day-to-day activities, such as in-person shopping.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: POTENTIAL OPPORTUNITIES ARISE AMID IMPROVING CONDITIONS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The ongoing economic recovery is estimated to boost demand for jewelry as disposable income rises and consumers grow confident. Improving economic conditions are likely to support demand for discretionary products, supporting domestic manufacturers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: TRADE ACTIVITY IS AFFECTED BY POLITICAL TENSION
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the global market continues to recover from the effects of the pandemic and other global conflicts, the US dollar is forecast to depreciate. A weakening dollar makes domestic jewelry comparatively more affordable for buyers, making it an attractive alternative.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: 3D PRINTING WILL CONTINUE TO GROW IN POPULARITY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: 3D printers are mainly used in the design process, as it lets customers visualize the final product. The implementation of 3D printing technologies can help manufacturers become more efficient by enhancing printing and design capabilities.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry manufacture jewelry or silverware using precious or semiprecious metals and stones. Costume jewelry manufacturers, specialty coin producers and lapidaries (artisans that form stones, minerals and other durable materials into decorative items such as cameos and engraved gems) are also included in this industry.
key_trends: Jewelry is very similar by nature, requiring manufacturers to offer a wide range of styles. This creates a need for having little inventory for multiple pieces.
Prominent import penetration leads to intense price competition. A strong US dollar makes imports more affordable in the United States, forcing domestic manufacturers to lower their prices.
High import penetration increases price competition. This has negatively affected profitability and pushed out manufacturers unable to lower prices.

Volatile input prices increased operating costs significantly, preventing many manufacturers from lowering their prices. Jewelry manufacturing is highly price competitive, negatively affecting domestic producers.
Major companies design new themed collections to appeal to customers. These collections are often in collaboration with artists and athletes.
Consumers consider brand values before purchasing. This has pushed major manufacturers to make statements regarding sustainability and social causes.
Growing interest rates and inflation have lowered the sales of discretionary products, affecting industry demand.

market_segmentation.segment: Wholesalers of precious metals and stones
market_segmentation.segment_description: This includes the sale of multiple pieces of jewelry as well as lapidary work, which is the cutting or shaping, polishing and engraving of stones.

Jewelry made out of precious metals and stones has higher prices than other segments, making them vulnerable to changes in consumer spending and behavior. Unstable downstream demand in recent years have impacted wholesalers.

Costume jewelry is typically of lesser quality than fine jewelry and, therefore, more affordable and widely purchased by consumers. Due to lower quality products, manufacturers cannot mark up products or pass down cost increases to consumers, limiting profitability. Because costume jewelry is more affordable, sales are impacted to a lesser degree by fluctuating economic conditions.

Findings are unfinished pieces of jewelry but the components necessary to fasten or tighten completed jewelry pieces. Wholesalers of jewelry findings distribute clasps, ear wires, loops, ring blanks and other pieces.
Manufacturers can also sell jewelry directly to retailers and consumers.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Precious metal jewelry and accessories made from gold and platinum
products_and_services.product_description: Items in this category are made from gold, silver, platinum and other similar metals or alloys (a combination of metals), incorporating stones, such as diamonds, rubies, emeralds and sapphires, into the design. Manufacturers produce various jewelry products, including bracelets, necklaces, earrings, rings, brooches, pins, encrusted wallets and cases, watches, bands and cuff links.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Precious and semi-precious metal jewelry excluding gold and platinum
products_and_services.product_description: Jewelry made out of precious and semiprecious metals offers similar-looking products to jewelers using gold and platinum. Producing similar-looking jewelry at a lower cost makes jewelry more attractive to consumers looking for good-quality and more affordable pieces.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Jewelers' materials and lapidary work manufacturing
products_and_services.product_description: Lapidaries are artisans or gem cutters who create standard or custom jewelry pieces with motorized equipment, engraving or etching precious metal solids and making jewelry out of cut or carved stones, such as diamonds, emeralds and rubies.
Costume jeweler pieces are an affordable alternative to fine jewelry, making pieces with inexpensive gemstones set in nickel, brass or pewter (as opposed to silver, gold or platinum).
Jewelry manufacturers also produce silverware and holloware, miscellaneous jewelry items and products not categorized in jewelers' findings and materials.
